title: Government announces appointments to Hong Kong Council on Smoking and Health
content_text: The Government also announced the re-appointment of seven serving members, Dr David Lam Tzit-yuen, Dr Haston Liu Wai-ming, Dr Loletta So Kit-ying, Mr Teddy Tang Chun-keung, Mr Richard Tsang Lap-ki, Dr Stewart Tung Yuk and Dr Kelvin Wang Man-ping, as well as the appointment of Mr Langton Cheung Yung-pong, Mr Clement Fung Cheuk-nang, Dr Sharmila Gurung and Professor Phoenix Mo Kit-han as new members.  All the appointments will be effective from October 1, 2020, for

new members.  All the appointments will be effective from October 1, 2020, for a term of two years.  The Hong Kong Council on Smoking and Health is an independent statutory body established in 1987 to advise the Government on matters related to smoking and health. It is also tasked to advance public education concerning the effects of smoking on the community and individuals as well as to engage in smoking-related research. The full membership of the Council with effect from October 1, 2020, is as follows: Mr Henry Tong Sau-chai (Chairman) Dr Johnnie Casire Chan Chi-kau

Mr Henry Tong Sau-chai (Chairman) Dr Johnnie Casire Chan Chi-kau (Vice-Chairman) Mr Langton Cheung Yung-pong Mr Clement Fung Cheuk-nang Dr Sharmila Gurung Dr Tony Ha King-hang Dr Daniel Ho Sai-yin Dr David Lam Tzit-yuen Dr Haston Liu Wai-ming Professor Phoenix Mo Kit-han Dr Loletta So Kit-ying Mr Teddy Tang Chun-keung Mr Richard Tsang Lap-ki Dr Stewart Tung Yuk Dr Kelvin Wang Man-ping Ms Sandy Wong Hang-yee Controller, Regulatory Affairs, Department
Yuk Dr Kelvin Wang Man-ping Ms Sandy Wong Hang-yee Controller, Regulatory Affairs, Department of Health
